Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: British mesh fencing systems maker Zaun discloses a LockBit ransomware attack that potentially led to the compromise of data related to UK military and intelligence sites.
The Associated Press warns of a data breach impacting AP Stylebook customers where the attackers used the stolen data to conduct targeted phishing attacks.

Researchers from Securonix discover DB#JAMMER, an attack campaign where threat actors are compromising exposed MSSQL databases using brute force attacks and appear to be well tooled and ready to deliver the FreeWorld ransomware and Cobalt Strike payloads.
Researchers from INKY discover a phishing campaign impersonating PepsiCo and infecting victims with malware.

Target: Acadia Health AKA Just Kids Dental
Description: Acadia Health, which does business under the name Just Kids Dental, files a notice of data breach after discovering that its computer system and network were attacked by ransomware. 129,623 user records are compromised.

Author: 8BASE
Description: Fenn Termite & Pest Control is hit by a 8BASE ransomware attack.
Debenham High School says that all its computer facilities are offline as a result of a cyber attack.
The Highgate Wood School delays the beginning of the lessons by 6 days after suffering a cyber attack.

Researchers from Microsoft reveal that, following coups in some African nations, Russia is exploiting the instability with the manipulation of media channels to stoke anti-French sentiment, among other things.

Target: Civil society groups in South Korea
Description: Researchers from Interlab discover a new phishing attack likely targeting civil society groups in South Korea, leading to the discovery of a novel remote access trojan called SuperBear.
Cognizant / TMG files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed confidential consumer data stored on the company’s computer network.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Target: Indiana Family and Social Services Administration
Description: The Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA) posts a notice announcing that the protected health information of an estimated 212,193 Indiana Medicaid members was impacted by the MOVEit data breach affecting CareSource.
UnitedHealthcare notifies individuals across the country of a recent data breach after an unauthorized party was able to access a UHC broker portal.
Bienville Orthopaedic Specialists files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access and acquire certain information from its network.
North Mississippi Health Services reveals that they discovered unauthorized access through an employee’s email account after a phishing email was unintentionally opened.

Author: Circle Typhoon AKA DEV-0322
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the China-based threat group Circle Typhoon continues to target the US defense industrial base.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Volt Typhoon AKA DEV-0391
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the China-based threat group Volt Typhoon conducted multiple operations against US defense contractors.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Mulberry Typhoon AKA MANGANESE
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the China-based threat group Mulberry Typhoon conducted multiple operations against US defense contractors.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: China
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that China used AI-generated images to try to influence U.S. voters.
The Carlisle Area School District is hit with ransomware.

The Lawrence Public Schools are working to recover $2.7 million in funds that were recently “frozen” when a staffer responded to a phishing email sent by scammers posing as a vendor for the school district.

The U.K. National Cyber Security Center (NCSC) warns of prompt injection attacks in AI with threat actors manipulating the technology behind large language model chatbots to access confidential information, generate offensive content and "trigger unintended consequences."
Comitato Elettrotecnico Italiano, an educational institution, is hit by a suspected ransomware attack.

Author: Knight
Description: The Italian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-AGID) discovers a Knight ransomware campaign targeting organizations in Italy.
Freecycle.org, a platform that allows users to recycle their belongings, prompts 7 millions of users to reset their passwords after their credentials were compromised in a data breach.

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: Ukraine’s computer emergency response team (CERT-UA) reveals that the infamous Russian cyberespionage group APT 28 was caught attacking a critical energy facility in Ukraine.
Dutch semiconductor designer and manufacturer NPX discloses a data breach affecting the email addresses of users who had registered an account on npx.com, but had not used it for at least 18 months.

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: More than one million customers of Pizza Hut Australia appear to have had their data acquired by the threat actor named ShinyHunters.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Security Joes reveal that attackers are exploiting two recent MinIO vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-28432 and CVE-2023-28434) to breach object storage systems and access private information, execute arbitrary code, and potentially take over servers.
The German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin) announces that an ongoing distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack has been impacting its website.

Author: Lazarus Group
Description: Online cryptocurrency casino Stake.com announces that its ETH/BSC hot wallets had been compromised to perform unauthorized transactions, with over $40 million in crypto reportedly stolen.
Researchers from Phylum discover a campaign where threat actors uploaded malicious packages to PyPI, NPM, and RubyGems repositories, aimed at stealing user information from MacOS machines.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Newton Media is hit with a BlackCat ransomware attack.

Author: Nationalist
Description: A threat actor with the moniker of Nationalist claims to have hacked Simplicia and to have stolen the data of 152,000 employees.
The Maiden Erlegh Trust suffers a ransomware attack.

Author: ADHD
Description: The group of hacktivists ADHD claims to have breached Padova Net, the web portal of the municipality of Padova (Padua).

Author: Chaes
Description: Researchers from Morphisec reveal that the Chaes malware has returned as a new, more advanced variant that includes a custom implementation of the Google DevTools protocol for direct access to the victim's browser functions, allowing it to steal data using WebSockets.
The Coffee Meets Bagel dating platform confirms that last week's outage was caused by hackers breaching the company's systems and deleting company data.
The September 2023 Android security updates patches 33 vulnerabilities, including CVE-2023-35674, a zero-day bug currently targeted in the wild.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang claims to have hit the luxury chain Firmdale Hotels.

Author: Desorden
Description: The hacker group Desorden claims responsibility for a data breach on AIS Thailand, a prominent mobile operator in Thailand.

Target: Windows, Mac, and Linux users across Korea and Thailand
Description: Researcher from AhnLab discover an increase in the usage of the BlueShell malware by various threat actors, to target Windows, Mac, and Linux OS across Korea and Thailand.

Target: Financial and logistics organizations in Latin America.
Description: Researchers from Morphisec discover Chae$ 4, an advanced and previously unknown variant of the Chaes malware specifically designed to target clients of financial and logistics companies located in Latin America.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a phishing campaign distributing a new Agent Tesla variant via the exploitation of the CVE-2017-11882 and CVE-2018-0802 vulnerabilities.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a bogus URL shortener redirect campaign to low quality Q&A sites and monetize traffic via Google AdSense.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Delta Dental of California files a notice of data breach after discovering that attackers exploited the vulnerability in MOVEit, the file-transfer application used by the company.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Cactus ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Foroni, an Italian manufacturer of nickel and specialty alloys and leaks a sample of 18 mb of data.

Author: W3LL
Target: Over 56,000 corporate Microsoft 365 accounts in the USA, Australia and Europe
Description: Researchers from Group-IB reveal that a threat actor known as W3LL developed a phishing kit that can bypass multi-factor authentication along with other tools that compromised more than 56,000 Microsoft 365 corporate accounts.

Author: Pandora
Description: Researchers from Dr.Web discover a new Mirai malware botnet infecting inexpensive Android TV set-top boxes,  such as Tanix TX6 TV Box, MX10 Pro 6K, and H96 MAX X3 used by millions for media streaming.

Date Occurred: Since at least end of August 2023
Author: Multiple ransomware operators including Akira and LockBit
Description: Cisco warns of a CVE-2023-20269 zero-day vulnerability in its Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) actively exploited by ransomware operations to gain initial access to corporate networks.
Researchers at TrueSec discover a new phishing campaign abusing Microsoft Teams to send malicious attachments that install the DarkGate Loader malware.
Ticketing services agency See Tickets notifies more than 300,000 individuals that their payment card data was stolen in a new web skimmer attack.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The city council of Seville is hit by a ransomware LockBit ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new malvertising campaign distributing the Atomic macOS Stealer, or AMOS.

Author: Dunghill Leak
Description: Travel booking giant Sabre says to be investigating claims of a cyberattack after a tranche of files purportedly stolen from the company appears on the The Dunghill Leak ransomware group leak site, who alleged it took about 1.3 terabytes of data.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a phishing campaign impersonating the popular money services platform known as Wise.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a phishing campaign impersonating Instagram

Researchers from Bitdefender discover a phishing campaign impersonating the financial institution BRD - Groupe Société Générale informing bank customers they need to use additional authentication methods to access their accounts.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover multiple Ukraine-themed spam campaigns.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover an Illuminati-themed spam campaign targeting users in Italy
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a tax refund scam targeting New Zealanders.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a tax refund scam targeting New Zealanders.

The Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) in Minnesota notifies jobseekers of a data breach involving unauthorized access to their personal information at the MinnesotaWorks.net platform, after a person claiming to be an employee allegedly, viewed and copied user resume information without authorization.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The St Augustine Academy suffers a ransomware attack.

Author: Cactus
Description: The real estate agency Seymours is listed among the victims of the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Cactus
Description: The Groupe Promotrans is listed among the victims of the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Cactus
Description: Mineman, a marketing company for mining, is listed among the victims of the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Cactus
Description: Maxxd Trailers is listed among the victims of the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Cactus
Description: Marfrig Global Foods is listed among the victims of the Cactus ransomware gang.

Author: Chinese threat actor
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover an Android Spyware campaign targeting Android users in South Korea.

Target: Organizations in Australia, Poland, and Belgium
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover 'Steal-It', a campaign is leveraging the PowerShell script associated with Nishang, a legitimate red teaming tool to steal NTLMv2 hashes from compromised Windows systems primarily located in Australia, Poland, and Belgium.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Majestic Spice among its victims.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Bordelon Marine among its victims.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Master Interiors among its victims.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Kikkerland Design among its victims.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Precisely among its victims.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware gang lists Micro Automation among its victims.

Amerita, a subsidiary of PharMerica, files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access and potentially acquire sensitive data from the company’s IT network.

Lyon Real Estate files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s computer network through a vulnerability in a vendor application program used by Lyon
NOW Health Group reveals that the protected health information of 4,661 individuals was compromised in a phishing attack.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems (Janssen) informs its CarePath customers that their sensitive information was compromised in a MOVEit data breach involving IBM.

Target: Users in France, Switzerland, U.S., Canada, Algeria, Sweden, Germany, Tunisia, Madagascar, Singapore and Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new campaign where cybercriminals are leveraging a legitimate Windows tool called 'Advanced Installer' to infect the computers of graphic designers with cryptocurrency miners.
Country: CA CH DE DZ FR MG SE SG TN US VN

Author: Threat actors from North Korea
Description: Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) reveal that North Korean state hackers are again targeting security researchers in attacks using at least one zero-day vulnerability in an undisclosed popular software.

Apple releases emergency security updates to fix two new zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-41064 and CVE-2023-41061) exploited as part of a zero-click exploit chain (dubbed BLASTPASS) to deploy NSO Group's Pegasus commercial spyware in attacks targeting iPhone and Mac users.

Author: Multiple threat actors from North Korea
Description: Researchers from Microsoft disclose that North Korean hacking groups have breached multiple Russian government and defense targets since the start of the year.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new campaign abusing Google Looker Studio to create counterfeit cryptocurrency phishing websites that phish digital asset holders, leading to account takeovers and financial losses.

Author: Threat actors from Iran
Description: A joint advisory published by CISA, the FBI, and the United States Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM) reveals that Iranian state-backed hacking groups have breached a U.S. aeronautical organization using exploits targeting critical Zoho ManageEngine (CVE-2022-47966) and Fortinet (CVE-2022-42475) vulnerabilities.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds to its catalog of known exploited vulnerabilities a critical–severity issue tracked as CVE-2023-33246 that affects Apache’s RocketMQ distributed messaging and streaming platform.
Fortress Trust discloses a theft of customers’ cryptocurrency last week, later revealed to total close to $15 million, stemming from a cyber attack suffered by Retool, a cloud provider.

Author: victim
Description: In-game trading marketplaces Traderie and another marketplace, Nookazon, owned by the same parent company Akrew, alert users to a data breach impacting their personal information. A threat actor called “victim” claims to be selling the data of as many as 2.6 million users for $5,000 in bitcoin.

Researchers from Group-IB Digital uncover a malicious campaign targeting users in the Middle East, and leveraging almost 900 scam pages with potential financial damage estimated at $280,000 between March-June 2023.

Author: Trigona
Description: The Trigona ransomware gang claims to have hit the Hong Kong’s Cyberport, and to have stolen 436 GB of data.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for a DDoS attack on Wells Fargo’s website

Author: Cyb3r Drag0nz Team
Target: Ministry of National Education in Morocco
Description: The collective Cyb3r Drag0nz Team claims to have successfully breached the Ministry of National Education in Morocco.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Bitdefender discover financially motivated attackers developing custom malware to exploit multiple zero-day flaws in IRM-NG, a popular property management software used by resorts and hotels.

Researchers from Zscaler observe a surge in tech-support scams exploiting pirated movie streaming websites and X (formerly Twitter), with a noteworthy focus on the utilization of Windows Action Center notifications to display misleading warning messages to users.
Lifeline Systems Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized person accessed documents containing confidential data on the company’s computer network.
United Healthcare Services files a notice of data breach involving “Unauthorized Access/Disclosure'' of sensitive information that was being stored on an affected network server.
Ryders Health Management confirms that unauthorized individuals gained access to its network and used ransomware to encrypt files.

Author: Ragnar Locker
Description: The Ragnar Locker ransomware gang adds Do IT Consultants to their list of victims and claims to have stolen 613 GB of data.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Proto Sign.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The NoEscape ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Omniatel, with the alleged possession of 360 gb of data.
Dymocks Booksellers warns customers their personal information was exposed in a data breach after the company's database was shared on hacking forums.

Author: Threat actor from China
Target: Chinese-speaking users and the Uighur ethnic minority
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover 'Evil Telegram' a campaign carried out via several malicious Telegram clones for Android on Google Play, installed over 60,000 times, infecting people with spyware that steals user messages, contacts lists, and other data, and appearing to be tailored for Chinese-speaking users and the Uighur ethnic minority.
Researchers from Akamai claim they identified and thwarted a massive distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack targeting a prominent American financial institution.
Researchers from Zscaler detail a new malware loader, named HijackLoader, which has grown in popularity over the past few months.

Author: Ransomed
Description: The Ransomed group adds Linktera to their dark web portal, claiming to have successfully gained unauthorized access to their database.

Author: Five Families
Description: The hacktivist group known as “Five Families” claims responsibility for a cyber attack targeting Biostar, a computer hardware accessories manufacturer.
Just one day prior to the G20 summit 2023, a surge in G20 scams is observed, targeting individuals in India.

Target: Washington DC-based organization with international offices
Description: An individual employed by a Washington DC-based organization with international offices is targeted with NSO Group's Pegasus.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Community Trust Bank provides notice of a data security incident after discovering that one of the company’s vendors experienced a data breach related to the vendor’s use of the file-transfer application MOVEit.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Northfield Bank discloses a third-party data breach involving the commonly used file transfer application MOVEit.
Sightpath Medical files a notice of data breach on behalf of Sutter North Surgery Center after discovering that an unauthorized actor accessed certain files stored within its systems.
Brady Martz & Associates files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access portions of the company’s computer network.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang adds Skokie-Morton Grove School District 69 to their leak site.
Decatur ISD suspects a cybersecurity attack is behind the disruptions to the school district’s internet and phone service.
St. Paul Public Schools notifies families and staff of a “data security incident” that may have exposed students’ names and email addresses.

Date Occurred: During April 2022 and then again in June 2023
Author: TheSnake
Description: A threat actor known as “TheSnake” leaks some data from Coca-Cola FEMSA with a claim that they had acquired a full database wit 8.16 GB of data.
Software bug-tracking company Rollbar discloses a data breach after unknown attackers hacked its systems in early August and gained access to customer access tokens.

Target: 15 members of the Yesh Atid political party in Israel
Description: Shin Bet, the Israel's security agency investigates a potential phone breach of opposition party lawmakers, after 15 members of the Yesh Atid political party, including the Israeli opposition leader Yair Lapid, have their WhatsApp accounts temporarily blocked, sparking concerns about potential phone hacking.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Threat actors from Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Guardio Labs discover a campaign where attackers are using a massive network of fake and compromised Facebook accounts to send out millions of Messenger phishing messages to target Facebook business accounts with password-stealing malware.
An attacker compromises Vitalik Buterin’s Twitter account and shares a post promoting a malicious NFT giveaway, being able to steal over $690,000, including valuable NFTs.

Author: Charming Kitten (AKA Phosphorus, TA453, APT35/42, Ballistic Bobcat)
Target: 34 organizations in Brazil, Israel, and the United Arab Emirates
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a new campaign by the Iranian nation-state threat actor known as 'Charming Kitten' (Phosphorus, TA453, APT35/42) has been observed deploying a previously unknown backdoor malware named 'Sponsor' against 34 companies around the globe.

Author: Scattered Spider with ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: MGM Resorts International discloses to be dealing with a cybersecurity issue that impacted some of its systems, including its main website, online reservations, and in-casino services, like ATMs, slot machines, and credit card machines. The BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: MetaStealer
Description: Researchers from SentinelOne discover a new information stealer malware named 'MetaStealer', stealing a wide variety of sensitive information from Intel-based macOS computers.
Sri Lanka’s government email network is hit by a ransomware attack that wipes months of data from thousands of email accounts.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Snatch and Nokoyawa
Description: The Canadian Nurses Association (CNA) confirms that it is working with its members to respond to a leak of sensitive data allegedly stolen by the Snatch and Nokoyawa ransomware group.
Researchers from Fortinet identify a new phishing campaign using Microsoft Word to distribute three malware strains: RedLine Clipper, Agent Tesla, and OriginBotnet.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: The hacktivist group Anonymous Sudan launches a DDoS attack against Telegram in retaliation to the messaging platform’s decision to suspend their primary account.
Google releases an emergency Chrome 116 security update to patch CVE-2023-4863, the fourth zero-day vulnerability discovered in the browser in 2023.

Author: 8BASE
Description: The 8BASE ransomware group claims responsibility for targeting COVESA, a network of Ford dealerships in the provinces of Barcelona and Girona in Spain.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to TissuPath.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Strata Plan.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Barry Plant Blackburn.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for an attack to Tisher Liner FC Law.

Author: Hacktivist Indonesia
Description: In name of OpIndia, PathLegal, an online legal service provider in India, falls victim to a data breach by the cybercriminal group Hacktivist Indonesia, resulting in the exposure of sensitive information belonging to 127,000 legal professionals and students.

Author: Cuba
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky uncover a fresh malware samples attributed to the ransomware group Cuba, representing new versions of the BurntCigar malware, which offers a new level of stealth to the group.

Texas Medical Liability Trust files a notice of data breach on behalf of itself and its affiliates, Texas Medical Insurance Company, Physicians Insurance Company, and Lone Star Alliance (TMLT), explaining that an incident resulted in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information.
Bloom Health Centers identifies suspicious activity in its Microsoft 365 email environment
A DDoS attack takes down Roma Capitale websites managed by Zetema of the cultural project, including that of the superintendency, the municipal museums, and the tourism one
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The City of Grant is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Redfly (subgroup of Winnti Group, also known as APT41, Bronze Atlas)
Target: National electricity grid organization in Asia
Description: Researchers from Broadcom/Symantec reveal the details of an espionage threat group tracked as 'Redfly', targeting a national electricity grid organization in Asia and quietly maintaining access to the breached network for six months.

Author: Threat Actors from Ukraine
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of a reported long-lasting Free Download Manager supply chain attack redirecting Linux users to a malicious Debian package repository that installed information-stealing malware.
Adobe releases security updates to patch CVE-2023-26369, a zero-day vulnerability in Acrobat and Reader tagged as exploited in attacks.

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) confirms that the zero-day vulnerabilities related to Microsoft Word (CVE-2023-36761) and Microsoft Streaming Service Proxy (CVE-2023-36802). are being used in attacks, adding them to the list of known exploited vulnerabilities.

Author: Storm-0324
Description: Microsoft says that Storm-0324, an initial access broker known for working with ransomware groups such as FIN7 (AKA Sangria Tempest and ELBRUS) has recently switched to Microsoft Teams phishing attacks to breach corporate networks.
Mozilla releases emergency security updates to fix CVE-2023-4863, a critical zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild, impacting its Firefox web browser and Thunderbird email client.

Author: Lazarus Group?
Description: Global cryptocurrency exchange CoinEX announces that someone hacked its hot wallets and stole large amounts of digital assets that were used to support the platform's operations. The loss is estimated in $53 million worth and the fingers are pointed to the North Korean Lazarus.

Target: One automaker in Europe and two in the U.S
Description: Researchers from Kasada reveal that cybercriminals appear to have deployed bots to break into customer accounts at several large automakers, then harvested important information about around 15,000 individuals using automated account takeover (ATO), and offered it for sale in private Telegram channels.

Author: BianLian
Description: The global charity organization Save the Children International confirms that it was recently hit with a cyberattack after the BianLian ransomware group claimed to have breached the organization’s systems.

Author: USDoD
Description: The European aerospace giant Airbus says to be investigating a cybersecurity incident following reports that a threat actor named USDoD posted information on 3,200 of the company’s vendors to the dark web.
Hinds County is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a previously unseen dropper variant named MidgeDropper, with a complex infection chain that includes code obfuscation and sideloading.

Target: More than 40 companies across multiple industries in Colombia
Description: Researchers at Check Point discover a new large-scale phishing campaign targeting more than 40 companies across multiple industries, in Colombia, and distributing the “Remcos” malware.
A cyberattack causes St. Louis County to shut down some computer systems used to look up court cases, issue charges and process people in custody at the jail.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from IBM discover a new version of the DBatLoader used to deliver payloads such as Remcos, Warzone, Formbook, and AgentTesla.
The City of Tomball, Texas files a notice of data breach after learning that the City was the recent target of a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A potential cyber attack is causing classes to be cut to a half day in East Jackson Community Schools.

Author: 3AM
Description: Researchers from Symantec/Broadcom discover 3AM, a new ransomware family used as fallback in failed LockBit attacks.

Author: Threat actors apparently coming from Mexico
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign where threat actors use Google Ads tracking templates as a loophole to create convincing Webex software search ads that redirect users to websites that distribute the BatLoader malware.
Software company Retool says the accounts of 27 cloud customers were compromised following a targeted and multi-stage social engineering attack.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal that the BlackCat (ALPHV) ransomware gang now uses stolen Microsoft accounts and the recently spotted Sphynx encryptor to encrypt targets' Azure cloud storage.

An investigation by Access Now and Citizen Lab reveals that the phone of Galina Timchenko, owner of the Russian independent media outlet Meduza and prominent Russian journalist and critic of the Kremlin was infected with Pegasus spyware.

Author: NoEscape
Description: The International Joint Commission (IJC), the organization tasked with managing the lake and river systems along the border between the U.S. and Canada, announces that it experienced a cyberattack following reports that the NoEscape ransomware gang claimed to have stolen reams of data.

Author: RansomHouse ?
Description: Multiple prominent government ministries in Colombia, including the Ministry of Health and Social Protection, the country’s Judiciary Branch and the Superintendency of Industry and Commerce, announce that an alleged ransomware attack on technology provider IFX Networks Colombia, caused a range of problems limiting the ability of departments to function.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Threat actors distributing the RedLine and Vidar infostealers
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the threat actors behind the RedLine and Vidar infostealers are now distributing ransomware payloads using Extended Validation (EV) code signing certificates.
An email account related to the Butler County is compromised, sending unauthorized spam emails.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a new LokiBot campaign using malicious Microsoft Office documents, exploiting CVE-2021-40444 and CVE-2022-30190.

Author: ADHD
Description: The ADHD hacktivist group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to SDA, the shipping company of Poste Italiane (the Italian Post Office) and leaks a sample with 100,000 records.

Target: Undisclosed supplier of the United Kingdom's Greater Manchester Police (GMP)
Description: United Kingdom's Greater Manchester Police (GMP) discloses that some of its employees' personal information was impacted by a ransomware attack that hit a third-party supplier.

Author: APT33 (aka Peach Sandstorm, HOLMIUM, or Refined Kitten)
Target: Thousands of defense organizations in the U.S. and worldwide
Description: Microsoft says an Iranian-backed threat group has targeted thousands of defense organizations in the U.S. and worldwide in password spray attacks since February 2023.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Scattered Spider AKA UNC3944 and 0ktapus
Description: Caesars Entertainment, self-described as the largest U.S. casino chain with the most extensive loyalty program in the industry, says it paid a ransom to avoid the online leak of customer data stolen in a recent cyberattack.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Auckland Transport (AT) transportation authority in New Zealand is dealing with a widespread outage caused by a cyber incident, a suspected ransomware attack, impacting a wide range of customer services.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang adds the Carthage Area Hospital to their list of victims.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang adds the Claxton-Hepburn Medical Center to their list of victims.

More Russian journalists come forward expressing concern that they too may have been targeted with Pegasus spyware: Maria Epifanova, CEO of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Evgeniy Pavlov, a correspondent for Novaya Gazeta Baltia, Evgeny Erlich, a journalist-in-exile at the Russian-language outlet Current Time.
A threat actor dubbed Tanaka leaks a database with 320,000 patient records, belonging to the Ministry of Ayush in Jharkhand, India.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Sylhet Gang
Description: In name of OpIndia the threat actors from the collective Sylhet Gang claim to have taken down the City Union Bank.

Author: Sylhet Gang
Description: In name of OpIndia the threat actors from the collective Sylhet Gang claim to have taken down the Dakshin Bihar Gramin Bank.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware group claims to have hit American Steel & Aluminum Co, gaining access to 70GB of data.

Target: Facebook business account in Southern Europe and North America
Description: Researchers from Netskope discover a campaign using a new variant of NodeStealer to steal Facebook users’ credentials and browser data, and targeting Facebook business accounts in Southern Europe and North America with bogus Facebook messages with a malicious file attached.

Author: Scattered Spider AKA UNC3944 and 0ktapus
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the financially motivated group UNC3944 has expanded its criminal arsenal to deploy ransomware and other intrusion capabilities on various cloud applications.
Researcher from Deep Instinct discover Operation Rusty Flag, a campaign targeting organizations in Azerbaijan.
Pharm-Pacc files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to its computer network.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Patients of CommonSpirit Health had their data compromised in the massive MOVEit hack.

Target: Multiple hotels, booking sites and travel agencies
Description: Researchers from Perception Point discover a multi-step information stealing campaign with attackers breaching the systems of hotels, booking sites, and travel agencies and then using their access to go after financial data belonging to customers.

Author: TA866
Target: Tatar language-speaking users in a particular region of Russia.
Description: Reseaarchers from Cyble discover a campaign targeting Tatar language-speaking users using a Python malware capturing screenshots.
Trucking and fleet management solutions provider ORBCOMM confirms that a ransomware attack is behind recent service outages preventing trucking companies from managing their fleets.

Author: Bumblebee
Description: Researchers from Intel471 reveal discover a new 'Bumblebee' campaign breaking its two-month vacation with a new distribution techniques that abuse 4shared WebDAV services.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The pro-Russian cybercrime group named NoName057(16) is observed launching distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks against Canadian organizations within the Government, as well as the financial and transportation sectors.
One of Thailand’s major digital financial platforms, CardX, discloses a data leak that affected their customers.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: The healthcare technology firm Nuance reveals that the Clop extortion gang has stolen personal data on Atrium Health as part of the Progress MOVEit Transfer campaign.

Description: The healthcare technology firm Nuance reveals that the Clop extortion gang has stolen personal data on Novant Health as part of the Progress MOVEit Transfer campaign.

Description: The healthcare technology firm Nuance reveals that the Clop extortion gang has stolen personal data on WakeMed Health & Hospitals as part of the Progress MOVEit Transfer campaign.

Limestone bank (now Peoples Bank) discloses a data breach exposing some 50,000 customers’ personal details, including financial account and credit card numbers, after it had “identified unusual activity involving an employee’s email account."
Skidmore College files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the school’s IT network through a ransomware attack.

Author: Clop AKA Lace Tempest, TA505, and FIN11
Description: Cadence Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that the MOVEit file transfer application used by Cadence, contained a critical vulnerability, with the incident resulting in an unauthorized party being able to access consumers’ sensitive information.
Oak Valley Hospital District files a notice of data breach with the Attorney General of California after experiencing a “cybersecurity incident.”
Sanford Health alerts certain patients that some of their protected health information was exposed in a security incident at its imaging vendor, DMS Health Technologies.
Jordan Valley Community Health Center discloses it identified suspicious activity in its computer systems. A forensic investigation revealed unauthorized individuals had access to its systems.
Mark Cuban, a renowned TV personality, investor, billionaire, and owner of the Dallas Mavericks has his hot wallet hacked, with the attacker able to drain around $900,000 worth of crypto.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: LockBit adds Hillsborough County Public Schools to their leak site, claiming to have acquired 2 TB of data, and providing a file list and some sample files.
The Better Business Bureau (BBB) warns students seeking for part-time employment or flexible work hours of scams involving attackers posing as professors or other faculty members.
Encore Pharmacy files a notice of data breach after confirming unauthorized access to a business email account.
Temple University Health System files a notice of data breach after discovering that information that had been entrusted to the organization was subject to unauthorized access.

Author: Cloak
Description: The Cloak ransomware gang claims responsibility for a ransomware attack to Euro2000
